posts.name: Nick C.
posts.cooked:
Recently got my hands on some dead SPARK MAXes and was tearing them down. Thought some others might want to know what makes them move so I’ve collected all the photos of the internals below. Please note if you try this the capacitors can still have charge and could be dangerous.

IMG_3107 1920×1440 331 KB IMG_3108 1920×1440 321 KB

IMG_3107 1920×1440 331 KB

IMG_3107 1920×1440 331 KB

IMG_3108 1920×1440 321 KB

IMG_3108 1920×1440 321 KB

FDECU3txpw 1920×1440 338 KB gRGqK9lKyW 1920×1440 356 KB

FDECU3txpw 1920×1440 338 KB

FDECU3txpw 1920×1440 338 KB

gRGqK9lKyW 1920×1440 356 KB

gRGqK9lKyW 1920×1440 356 KB

IMG_3112 1920×1440 347 KB

IMG_3112 1920×1440 347 KB

IMG_3112 1920×1440 347 KB

IMG_3116 1920×1440 267 KB hBeMh6eFvI 1920×1440 297 KB

IMG_3116 1920×1440 267 KB

IMG_3116 1920×1440 267 KB

hBeMh6eFvI 1920×1440 297 KB

hBeMh6eFvI 1920×1440 297 KB

IMG_3113 1920×1440 347 KB IMG_3106 1920×1440 351 KB

IMG_3113 1920×1440 347 KB

IMG_3113 1920×1440 347 KB

IMG_3106 1920×1440 351 KB

IMG_3106 1920×1440 351 KB

Quite a few interesting things going on, but it was surprisingly really simple. I have a few more high resolution images if anyone is interested but I think the ones I have up right now are pretty solid.

posts.name: Dan
posts.cooked: Nice! Some discussion last year too - I grabbed some pics with digital microscope What chip is in the spark max? - #5 by theworkshope

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked: Now the question is, can you run DOOM on it?

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked:
probably

heres a video of doom running on another (albeit 2.5x faster with 51x more ram) STM32 chip: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRNcfsDIc2A
